column10: Third time is NOT a charm
column11: This is my third Panasonic Lumix camera and all three times the camera has broken shortly after the warranty expired Each time the cost of repair is close to the cost of buying a new camera.  I will admit that I think it is a great camera while it is working but am very disappointed that seems to be made to only last about 1 year.  When I spoke to the representatives at Panasonic to explain my disappointment, their only response was 'K'.  I then said 'it seems like you really don't even care about your product' and again the response was 'K'. I will not be purchasing this brand again.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11: This is my second Panasonic Lumix camera that has developed spots on the inside of the lens where they cannot be reached without taking the camera apart. The first was a DMC-ZR1, purchased on February 16, 2010. The DMC-ZS7 was purchased on January 18, 2011. Both cameras were handled with great care - never got wet. I notified Panasonic when the first camera developed this problem, but, as it was out of warranty, they offered nothing more than an address to send the camera for repairs, which were almost as expensive as buying a new camera. I notified them of the DMC-ZS7's problem today, but this camera is also out of warranty, so I have low expectations. If Panasonic makes any effort to address my problem, I will update this review. Except for the lens spots, both cameras have performed very well.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11: I have had this product for two years. It used to take good photos when it was working. I have not used the camera very much, but recently I received a 'Focus Error' message 'Turn off Camera and Turn On Again.' I looked online and saw that many other people have had the same problem with this camera.  I called Panasonic, and they said it would cost $180 to have repaired. Disappointed in a product that doesn't last.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column10: Not rugged enough for the backcountry
column11:
I bought this camera primarily for use when motorcycling in the backcountry. From the get-go the lens cover has been susceptible to even small amounts of dust. It would stick closed or partially closed regularly, requiring assistance to open. Not a big deal when blown out with a can of air regularly. It did this even when always kept cased and in a plastic bag when not in use.

The camera got wet once when in the pocket of my riding jacket in a rain storm. Not flooded, just damp on the outside, resulting in condensation on/in the lenses. I set it in a bag of rice for 2 weeks...no go. Sent it off to be repaired...$180 IIRC. Worked fine for 3-4 day trips before dying a final time-no image on the display when you try to take a picture. Display itself works fine...must be in the image capture electronics. Tossing it this time and replacing with a waterproof/dustproof unit.

Otherwise, it was a great camera...good image quality, geotagging a nice feature and great zoom. Kind of like 'Other than that Mrs. Lincoln, how was the play?'.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column10: One of the Best All-in One Point & Shoots
column11:
I have been an avid photo nut for 30+ years. I wanted a small point & shoot for trips to places I've been before where I didn't want to carry around me DSLR. The short of it is, this is one of the top, by most reviews. I think the ZS10 is now available, but the ZS10 actually lowered some of the features to lesser quality.

Why this Point & Shoot? There's lots of features on this P&S, but here are the more notable features I love compared to other P&S cameras:

1) It's one of (2) P&S which allows not only Manual Settings, but full manual based on Aperture, Shutter & Picture. Many don't offer the ability to manually alter the Shutter Speed, let alone the Aperture. To those of us who are photo nuts who want full manual control, this camera delivers.

2) While just about all P & S cameras offer 12 or 14 megapixels, there is one small aspect they don't tell you. If you raise ISO settings (to allow more light) above 800, 99% of all P&S cameras default to only 6 megapixels. Meaning: you don't get that shot in 12 or 14 you thought you were taking. Panasonic has put a ton of money into fixing ISO issues with P&S cams, thus when you raise the ISO settings to 800, 1200, 2400, even 3200, the shot is still in 12 Megapixel. Only Nikon has one P&S that comes close to this.

3) The 12x optical zoom is more than you'll ever need, but covers a great focal length

4) Dual Stereo mics & GPS tagging. Love both features. It's nice to get full sound recording

I've used this camera on many travels and love it. I recently searched this camera and see the prices are, at times, higher than when it was introduced; it's in that high of a demand. I highly recommend.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column10: When life hands you a lemon
column11: My Panasonic Lumix DMC ZS7 was only a camera for fourteen months.  Now it's a paperweight.  After 14 months of fairly easy duty, with no excessive exposure to moisture and/or no accidental drops or shocks to the camera, it's auto-focus feature has stopped working.  A very expensive paperweight.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column10: Great camera until it broke a couple of months after warranty expired
column11: I purchased this camera from Costco for a reasonable price after comparing several different manufacturers and deciding this was the superior choice. The camera took great pictures and was easy to use. I was very happy with it. At my daughter's graduation the camera's lense began to stop functioning. I could hear the motor turning and trying to retract and extend the lense but the lense wouldn't respond. I then received an error message on the camera screen stating there was an error and to restart the camera which did not resolve the issue. I called Panasonic and they said it was out of warranty and I could have the camera exchanged for a refurbished one for $180.00 dollars. I will throw this camera in the trash and buy either a canon or a nikon.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)

I read all the reviews and I am so happy I went with this one.  NO problems with this camera whatsoever.  And it takes the greatest pictures and video.  You won't be sorry you purchased this.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11: I've taken very good photos with the camera and love the zoom and compactness BUT the camera malfunctioned after 8 months.  They had me ship it back and sent me another one.  What I didn't know was that under warranty, they send back a refurbished camera.  That would have been fine but the one I received was banged up and scratched to the point where the model & serial # were barely readable.  After the year warranty was up (5 months later), the camera malfunctioned in 5 different ways.  I had bought a 5 yr extended warranty when originally purchasing the camera but even the camera repair shop had trouble fixing the camera.  In the end, they fixed 4 out of 5 problems and one of the fixed problems has gradually gotten worse - ie. trying to get the camera to focus on closeups have a 65% chance of NOT working.  I could send it back for repair again but I will be out the cost of shipping it back again, plus paying the $10 service charge each time it's serviced and I am without a camera for each 'repair time'.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11: I bought this camera after reviewing several point and shoot cameras.  It is lightweight, easy to carry and the rechargeable battery lasts a long time.  I don't use all the various functions and generally use it as a basic point and shoot camera for grandkid shots.  I shoot action shots of kids playing sport using the zoom and I use the flash and close up mode.  I have had good results and am happy with the camera.  The shutter speed is better than most lightweight point and shoot cameras I have tried but still not as fast as the larger digital 35 mm Canon and other brands. But for lightweight, ease of use, batter life and good pictures it is a good buy.  It is very easy to carry in your pocket.  While I have a smart phone I rather use the Lumix for times I know I am going to be taking pictures such as sporting events or Disney World.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11: I can slip the camera into my coat pocket and go all day without recharging the battery. No matter how many pictures I take the battery never fails me.  Pictures are sharp and colors are true.  I have received many favorable compliments on the pictures I have taken.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)

column11: I bought this camera for my wife, we take it on all of our trips. It takes great pictures and has a rechargable battery which makes it very convenient.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11:
I have used and abused this camera and I have taken it to the beach and have carried this mountain biking. It still works. Love the optical zoom. 12x means I can take pictures without the subject knowing I'm taking pictures of them.

The body is already corroded from the sweat from my hands, but there's not damage as to the function and the crispness of the shots.

column11: My husband hunts with our Setters and he loves the size of this camera to take with him.  It takes good pictures and the size is such that he can hang it from his belt on a case or tuck it into a pocket to use quickly.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11:
The camera, when working is pretty good. I loved the 12x optical zoom and thought picture quality was very good when shooting in good light. It suffered a bit in low light situations but I learned to live with that.

Like several other reviewers here, my camera stopped working right as the 1yr warranty expired. I got Panasonic to replace it with a refurb camera but only after repeated phone calls and some bitching, and now 8 months after they sent me the replacement, it too has stopped working with the same 'system focus error' message.

It wasn't too expensive ($200 or so at Costco) and would be well worth that if it would last, but as it stands I'll be looking to another brand for a replacement...

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column10: Great Camera With Many Manual Features For The Skilled Amateur
column11:
I love this camera.

Nearly everything about it from the manual settings to the zoom and GPS is great. I take alot of panoramas and the assist is great. The videos are HD. The light sensitivity is also good.

The only downside is there is no range finder, so you must use the LCD display which can be difficult in bright sunlight. This is true of all digital cameras without a range finder eyepiece.

I have recommended this cameras to other who also love it. I recently sunk it in a pond I was crossing and it failed, so it is not waterproof. But I liked it so much, I bought another one right away.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column10: It is the best camera that I have ever owned
column11: I have really enjoyed using this camera so far, and we have bought it for vacation so we will see how things go then.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11: Camera is very good quility and takes very good pictures.  Easy to to take with you on a trip.  We are happy with the overall purchase.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11:
The Panasonic DMC-ZS7 is a great little camera in almost every way. The controls are quite good, with a fairly low learning curve. The image qualty is good, but the white balance and color rendition are all over the place. The build quailty is also quite good. If the color balance was even close to consistent, or if you could cotrol it better with the white balance settings, I would have loved this camera. So, after trying this and a comparable Nikon I am headed back to a Canon brand.

Sorry Panasonic, I wanted to love you but your color interpretation was just too wacky for me.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11:
I am not a professional photographer. I wanted to buy a compact camera which is easy to carry while travelling and yet gives me crisp quality pics. This is one of the best cameras I have had...The picture and video quality is the best amongst the compact cameras family in my opinion. However, if you are a MAC user, the software could be a problem for use. You cannot watch the HD videos recorded on ur laptop. In fact you cannot watch the HD recordings without installing the software...something i was not aware before buying the cam. I had a spare PC which I use for this purpose and once the software installed, the HD recordings were running great and were actually phenomenal....That is the only reason why i give it 3 stars in the software tab.
Be sure to carry an extra battery and memory card.....coz battery goes down very fast and the memory card wil be full very fast with HD recordings....To save the battery power keep the GPS mode off...
There is one turn off to this cam...that is the pictures taken at night.....they are not great...
I had done a lot of research before pinning down to this cam( after reviewing Canons, Nikons, Sony) but trust me, You would not regret your decision with this cam.
I would still highly recommend this cam.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11: I bought this for my Mom because she really liked mine (the same unit) and she's enjoying taking pictures with it.  The pictures are  very clear.  For a good price, i think this was business done well.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11:
Panasonic has done a great job putting a plethora of useful features
including the 12x optical zoom and 12MP into such a sleek body. We had the
older TZ-1 which had a 10x zoom and was much bulkier. It also had a plastic
lens cap which was kinda cheesy. This model does away with that and shuts
automatically when the power is turned off. In the previous model the mode
dial had to be turned in order to shoot a movie but this one has a separate
movie record button on the back that makes it easy to start shooting right
away- good move Panasonic! The gps is also really handy for travelers and
can take the guesswork out of where the pic was taken. The quality of
pictures are excellent and the 720p movies are cleaner than many minidv
video cameras. The battery life is decent but I did buy an extra battery for
those long trips outdoors. So far we love this camera- it does everything we
need and does it well!!!!

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11:
I did a LOT of research before buying this Lumix camera, i am a long time user of a Nikon D 60, and was looking for a small camera with good video quality, after reading review after review and comparing camera's, I decided to give this one a try, I have to tell you, the video is amazing, my $600 camcorder can't even compare to the quality of the video I get from this camera,

I recently went to a concert and took a lot of video, I was not sitting very close at all, but the quality of the video looks like I was, sharp, clear and playback looks just like you are watching a movie on TV.

I have had this camera for about a month or so, and cannot think of one negative thing to say about it, I would buy it again in a hearbeat, it will be with me at all times, even when I am using my Nikon.

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column10: A great pocket size camera with BIG zoom!
column11:
I love my new camera. Well, it is actually over 8 months old now and I have take over 3,000 photos and over 250 videos. I love the results.

In the past, I would carry a much bigger camera with me when I traveled, but I wanted to down size. With the state of technology today, I was able to down size, without a big sacrifice in quality of the photo! I do not make large prints of my photos, so a very slight amount of distortion of the image at max zoom, does not both me. I use the camera to take photos and videos that I assemble into travel photoshow DVDs. The photoshow DVDs capture the true flavor of our trips and let me keep my memories for a lifetime! (If you wish to see a sample of the work I do with this camera... [...])

I highly recommend this camera to an average photographer, or to a pro, that understands that this camera will not give you the quality of an SLR, but is a spectacular value for the money!!

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column10: Great camera for HD video recording
column11:
There are already some great Amazon reviews on this camera, so I will add my portion with a focus on HD video recording.

Let me mention that I purchased this camera with the primary intent of recording HD videos for badminton practices and tournaments. These events are always held inside large gyms, lit up by several large bright lights that do an adequate job of lighting up the gym. My criteria were as follows:
1. 720p or greater HD video recording
2. Must be able to continuously record for at least 30mins
3. Pocket-size (I didn't want a bulky digital camcorder or DSLR)
4. Good still picture-taking qualities are a bonus (I didn't want a Flip video recorder)
5. Reasonable price, <$200

Here's how the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 satisfies my requirements:
1. It records 720p HD video in two formats: AVCHD and Motion JPG
2. The AVCHD format allows it to record 720p video indefinitely, given enough memory (on a 16GB SDHC card, the battery runs out at 1 hour 40 mins, while the card can support 2 hours of video)
3. It's not a slim camera that you can easily slip into your jeans, but still a compact digital that feels good in your hand and doesn't require a separate camera bag.
4. While it doesn't take the best pictures under low light conditions, it does quite well in all other settings. The 12x zoom is very nice.
5. I paid $199.99 for this when it was on sale. Above what I was looking to pay but once I saw this camera and all its features, I had to have it.

Accessories worth buying:
1. Wasabi Power batteries (Wasabi Power Battery and Charger Kit for Panasonic Lumix DMW-BCG10, DMW-BCG10E, DMW-BCG10PP, DMC-ZR3, DMC-ZS5, DMC-ZS6, DMC-ZS7)
2. Caselogic Case (Caselogic TBC-302 Ultra Compact Camera Case with Storage (Black))
3. 8GB, 16GB, or 32GB SDHC cards
4. Tripod

column2: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)
column11:
I bought this camera with high hopes. Initially, it fit the bill in everything I wanted in a pocket camera. The only negative in the image quality is under low light conditions, where it will always use the night setting on intelligent mode and give a very grainy and low quality picture. The biggest problem I am having with it is that it seems to have a HUGE problem with dust!! Already I have 4 dark spots in my pictures from dust and and little hair of dust that managed to get underneath the lenses. Unfortunately, I cannot return through Amazon this late and I have a bad feeling that this will be a continuing problem with this camera. Other than that, this was the best camera I could find in this price range but the dust problem is unacceptable. I am contacting Panasonic and I hope they will pay for the servicing to get this taken care of.

Update: After calling Panasonic customer support, they informed me that I will receive a different unit that is refurbished (great...) and also that I have to pay for shipping to send the camera to their facility, even though the rep. said it was a hardware problem after 2 months. Thanks Panasonic!
